author: Theallknowingsause

text: @The all knowing cause Hi! It seems English isn't your first language, let me help clear that up. Whenever there are multiples of something you add an 's' or 'es' at the end of the word to indicate such. Plok's OST is credited to Tim and Geoff Follin so in this case you would use the word 'composers'.
author: Matt Etter

text: Your is a possessive determiner meaning it shows ownership so your current sentence makes zero sense only further proving that English is in fact not your first language. The word you are looking for would be the contraction 'you're'.
author: Matt Etter

text: mjetter432 Troll
author: Bulletincent

text: i was born in america, just because you proved to an autistic kid that your smarter then him doesn't make you better then me, that means your a douchebag
author: Theallknowingsause

text: I think you meant to say 'than him', then is an adverb used to indicate a sense of time where as than is used for comparisons. I would advise brushing up on your English as you have shown very little mastery of the language just from a handful of comments.
author: Matt Etter

text: The horse raced past the barn fell.

text:
HA... your list is flawless, just as I figured. You got the other two great PLOK songs on here too...

The other great ones in this series besides this, Akrillic and Beach is the boss theme and that bonus stage where you go back on the first level and helicopter your way to a world warp.

text:
I remember reading about him and his origin in a comic in Nintendo Power.
Game magazines need to start including those mini comics in their issues again. It doesn't matter what the games are! They're all amazing, and were one of the reasons I subscribed to so many magazines in the old days!
